Article.ArticleTitle: Enhanced water-resistance of Mn-based catalysts for ambient temperature ozone elimination: Roles of N and Pd modification.

AbstractText: Cryptomelane-type MnO<sub>2</sub> catalysts own excellent ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) decomposition performance. However, it is urgent to improve their long-term stability at ambient temperature, especially under the presence of water. In the present study, a modification strategy was proposed by N-doping and the successive Pd introduction. The N-doping of MnO<sub>2</sub> by NH<sub>4</sub>Cl (NH<sub>4</sub>-MnO<sub>2</sub>) can increase its activity for O<sub>3</sub> decomposition. And almost 100% O<sub>3</sub> decomposition was achieved within 24 h under water-free atmosphere at ambient temperature (25 °C). Successive Pd addition further promoted the water-resistance of NH<sub>4</sub>-MnO<sub>2</sub> catalyst under high humidity (RH > 90%). In combination with detailed characterizations, it indicated that the enhancements on stability and water-resistance were attributed to synergistic effect among acid sites, oxygen defects and Pd clusters. Finally, the decomposition mechanism of gaseous O<sub>3</sub> was proposed based on three decisive active sites above.
